links.description: Exploring a Modern SMTPE 2110 Broadcast Truck With My Dad
links.summary: Jeff Geerling toured a modern SMPTE 2110 broadcast truck at St. Louis Blues hockey games to explore the digital infrastructure and timing systems that power live sports broadcasts. The truck relies on precision timing protocol (PTP) and Evertz grandmaster clocks to synchronize video, audio, and metadata across the network, with engineers manually setting time using atomic clock apps since GPS is unreliable in mobile venues. Beyond the technology, Geerling was most impressed by the skilled broadcast professionals and their coordinated teamwork to deliver high-quality productions, operating the complex equipment seamlessly behind the scenes.
links.page_title: Exploring a Modern SMTPE 2110 Broadcast Truck With My Dad - Jeff Geerling

links.summary: This page appears to be from Simon Willison's blog discussing recent developments in AI and software engineering, including articles about StrongDM's AI team building software without direct code review, running Pydantic's sandboxed Python subset in WebAssembly, and distributing Go binaries through PyPI. The focus seems to be on emerging techniques and tools for building AI-powered systems and managing code distribution in modern development workflows.

links.summary: The author reflects on how AI agents and coding models have dramatically evolved over the past year, with the latest frontier models now capable of writing 90% of their code compared to 25% a year ago. IDEs have become obsolete as agents provide superior tools, and using anything less than frontier models like Claude Opus actively hampers learning. The author emphasizes that most software architecture needs to be fundamentally redesigned for the agent-native world, and they're building exe.dev to create the ideal cloud infrastructure for agents without constraints.
links.page_title: crawshaw - 2026-02-08

links.summary: Game theory provides a framework for understanding organizational behavior by recognizing that outcomes depend on interconnected decisions and incentives rather than individual intentions. The article illustrates how organizations often struggle because well-intentioned people make locally rational decisions within poorly designed systemsâ€”such as promotion structures that reward visibility over impact, firing policies that encourage peer sabotage, or hiring processes that favor referrals over merit. Skilled leaders avoid these "traps" by designing transparent mechanisms and clear incentives that naturally drive desired outcomes, rather than hoping culture and values will guide behavior.
links.page_title: Game Theory Patterns at Work â€“ Daeus Jorento

links.summary: agent-slack is a TypeScript-based CLI tool that enables AI agents to automate Slack interactions with token-efficient JSON output designed for LLM consumption. It provides commands for reading messages and threads, searching content, managing reactions, listing users, and fetching Slack canvases as Markdown, with zero-config authentication that automatically works with Slack Desktop. The tool is available as both a standalone CLI and as an agent skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and other AI platforms.
links.page_title: GitHub - stablyai/agent-slack: Slack automation CLI for AI agents

links.description: The roots of Lisp - Paul Graham
links.summary: The roots of Lisp - Paul Graham

LispE (Lisp ElÃ©mentaire) is a compact, multi-platform Lisp dialect that combines functional programming, array language features, and object-oriented capabilities in a single language. It includes traditional Lisp operators, pattern matching, data structures, classes, threading support, and array operatorsâ€”enabling complex tasks like Conway's Game of Life to be solved in minimal code. The project is open-source under the BSD 3-Clause License and provides precompiled binaries for Windows and macOS, along with documentation and interactive examples to help users explore its features.
links.page_title: GitHub - naver/lispe: An implementation of a full fledged Lisp interpreter with Data Structure, Pattern Programming and High level Functions with Lazy Evaluation Ã  la Haskell.

links.description: Offpunk 3.0 - A command line web browser
links.summary: Offpunk 3.0, a command-line browser for offline web browsing across Web, Gemini, and Gopher protocols, has been released as a community-driven project with significant contributions from volunteers beyond the original developer. Key improvements include multi-language support, better content extraction from websites, image display enhancements, RSS feed discovery, cookie-based login capability, and new social sharing features. The release marks a milestone where Offpunk has evolved from a solo project into a genuine cooperative effort with an active community contributing translations, tools, and packaging support.
links.page_title: Offpunk 3.0 "A Community is Born" Release

links.summary: "The Man from the Future" is a biography of John von Neumann by Ananyo Bhattacharya that explores the life and contributions of one of history's most influential but underappreciated scientists. Von Neumann, a Hungarian-born child prodigy, made groundbreaking contributions across multiple fields including quantum mechanics, computer science, game theory, nuclear weapons design, and economics, fundamentally shaping the modern world. The book chronicles how his exceptional intellect and the unique historical circumstances of the 20th century allowed him to revolutionize diverse scientific disciplines and leave an indelible mark on contemporary civilization.
links.page_title: The Man from the Future: The Visionary Ideas of John von Neumann by Ananyo Bhattacharya | Goodreads

links.summary: Walker Percy's National Book Award-winning novel *The Moviegoer* follows Binx Bolling, a disillusioned New Orleans stockbroker approaching thirty who seeks meaning and escape through cinema and the chaos of Mardi Gras. Alongside his cousin Kate, Binx embarks on a transformative week-long journey that critiques modern materialism while exploring deeper questions of purpose and authenticity. The novel is a poignant examination of alienation and self-discovery set against the vibrant backdrop of carnival season.
links.page_title: Odd Lots Books

links.summary: Plan 9 is a distributed computing environment developed at Bell Labs that uses specialized componentsâ€”CPU servers for computation, file servers for storage, and terminals for user interfacesâ€”connected through a single file-oriented protocol to create an efficient and manageable system. Rather than using general-purpose workstations, Plan 9 achieves better security, reliability, and cost-effectiveness by centralizing services and using a unified file-based approach for all system resources, allowing a large organization to operate as a cohesive computing community with simplified administration. The system was designed to overcome limitations of traditional networked workstations by concentrating computing power, centralizing storage, and providing each user with a customized view of available services through a local file name space.
links.page_title: untitled

links.description: A community curated collection of Nancy Drew books
links.summary: This Open Library collection curates Nancy Drew books across multiple series and reading levels, spanning from the original 1930s mysteries to modern reimaginings published through the 2020s. The collection organizes titles by era and age groupâ€”including the classic Mystery Stories, young adult series like Nancy Drew Girl Detective and Nancy Drew On Campus, and early reader versions like Nancy Drew Notebooks and the Clue Bookâ€”making it easy for both new and returning readers to find appropriate starting points. Users can read, borrow, or preview available editions directly through the platform, with alternative copies often accessible if the primary listing is checked out.
links.page_title: Nancy Drew Collection | Open Library

links.summary: GitHub Agentic Workflows is a system that enables repository automation by running AI coding agents (Copilot, Claude, or Codex) directly in GitHub Actions with built-in security guardrails. Users can define automation tasks using simple markdown files instead of complex YAML, allowing AI agents to automatically handle tasks like issue triage, documentation maintenance, test coverage improvement, and compliance monitoring. The system prioritizes safety through read-only default permissions, explicit write operation approval, sandboxed execution, and tool allowlisting to ensure AI agents operate within controlled boundaries.
links.page_title: GitHub Agentic Workflows | GitHub Agentic Workflows

links.summary: A History of Algol 68

This wiki page documents the GNU Algol 68 front end for GCC, a compiler project that adds support for the Algol 68 programming language to the GCC compiler infrastructure. The page serves as a central resource hub containing information about project milestones, bug reporting, development resources, compiler modules, language features, and related documentation including testing procedures, runtime support, and editor modes for Algol 68 development.
links.page_title: Algol68FrontEnd - GCC Wiki

links.summary: This presentation introduces ga68, a newly developed GNU Algol 68 compiler that serves as a GCC front-end, presented by Jose E. Marchesi at FOSDEM 2026. The talk provides a quick overview of this recent addition to the GNU toolchain during a 25-minute session in the GCC track. Video recordings and chat discussions are available for those interested in learning more about this compiler development.
links.page_title: FOSDEM 2026 - ga68, the GNU Algol 68 Compiler

links.summary: Agent SOP is a framework that provides markdown-based instruction sets enabling AI agents to execute complex, multi-step tasks consistently and reliably across different AI systems. The SOPs define clear objectives, parameterized inputs, step-by-step instructions with constraints, and examples in a standardized format that can be distributed as MCP tools, Anthropic Skills, or Python modules. The project includes pre-built SOPs for common development workflows like codebase analysis, prompt-driven development, task generation, and test-driven code implementation, with support for integration into various AI tools including Strands Agents, Claude Code, Cursor IDE, and custom MCP-compatible assistants.
links.page_title: GitHub - strands-agents/agent-sop: Natural language workflows that enable AI agents to perform complex, multi-step tasks with consistency and reliability.

links.summary: Fluid.sh is an infrastructure tool that lets you safely test and experiment with system changes in isolated sandbox environments before deploying to production. It automatically explores your system configuration, logs every command and change for auditing purposes, and can generate reproducible Ansible playbooks from your sandbox work to streamline infrastructure deployment across multiple servers.
links.page_title: fluid.sh

links.summary: Agent Skills are packages of instructions, scripts, and resources that enable AI agents to work more accurately and efficiently by providing them with procedural knowledge and contextual information they can access on demand. The platform allows skill authors to build capabilities once and deploy them across multiple agent products, while enabling teams and enterprises to capture organizational knowledge in portable, version-controlled packages that support domain expertise, new capabilities, and repeatable workflows. Agent Skills is an open standard originally developed by Anthropic that is supported by leading AI development tools and remains open for contributions from the broader ecosystem.
links.page_title: Overview - Agent Skills

links.description: Deno Sandbox for AI-assisted coding with security, egress control, etc.
links.summary: Deno Sandbox is a new security-focused platform that enables safe execution of LLM-generated code by providing lightweight Linux microVMs with built-in protections against data exfiltration and unauthorized network access. The service features secret management that prevents API key theft by showing only placeholders to the code while materializing real credentials only during approved outbound requests, plus network egress controls that restrict which hosts sandboxed code can communicate with. Once code is tested and ready, it can be deployed directly to Deno Deploy with a single command, offering a seamless workflow from development sandbox to production serverless deployment.
links.page_title: Introducing Deno Sandbox | Deno

links.summary: John Baez explores how mathematical principles underlie musical tuning systems, explaining that different scales (5-note, 7-note, and 12-note) have evolved to best approximate simple frequency ratios, particularly the "fifth" at 3/2. While Pythagorean tuning sought pure rational number ratios, modern 12-tone equal temperament divides each octave into 12 equal parts, making it the dominant tuning system since around 1850 despite being mathematically simpler than its historical predecessors. The presentation demonstrates how mathematical innovations in tuning systems have driven the development of new musical styles throughout Western music history.
links.page_title: The Mathematics of Tuning Systems

The project has gained significant community interest with 562 stars and 16 forks on GitHub, indicating active development and adoption. It provides integrated tools for managing manufacturing operations, inventory, and business processes tailored to the needs of small manufacturing businesses.

links.summary: Elixir is a dynamic, functional programming language that runs on the Erlang VM to build scalable and maintainable applications with low-latency and fault-tolerant capabilities. It enables developers to work productively across multiple domains including web development, embedded software, machine learning, and data pipelines. The language combines Erlang's distributed systems strengths with modern tooling and syntax to support diverse industry use cases.

links.summary: Ash is an opinionated, declarative application framework for Elixir that provides a batteries-included development experience by offering built-in tools and conventions to streamline application development. The framework emphasizes declarative programming patterns, allowing developers to define application behavior through configuration rather than imperative code, while reducing boilerplate and providing comprehensive functionality out of the box.

links.description: Where is AI taking us - Eight leading thinkers share their visions
links.summary: Eight leading AI experts share their predictions for the next five years, with views ranging from cautiously optimistic to skeptical about transformative breakthroughs. While AI is expected to substantially impact programming, transportation, and scientific research, experts warn that the technology won't imminently solve major challenges like cancer or achieve artificial general intelligence, and that thoughtful governance will be crucial to maximizing benefits while mitigating risks. The consensus suggests AI will become increasingly integrated into everyday tools and work, but its most significant impacts will depend on how society chooses to deploy and regulate it rather than on the technology itself.
links.page_title: Opinion | Where Is A.I. Taking Us? Eight Leading Thinkers Share Their Visions. - The New York Times

links.description: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
links.summary: There is a stark divide emerging between AI users: "power users" who actively adopt advanced tools like Claude Code for diverse tasks across departments, and casual users limited to basic chatbots like ChatGPT. Enterprise organizations face a critical disadvantage due to restrictive IT policies, outdated legacy systems, and poor AI tools like Microsoft Copilot, while smaller companies with better APIs and flexibility are gaining unprecedented competitive advantages, creating a situation where tiny teams can now outperform much larger enterprises.
links.page_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging. The gap between them is astonishing. - Martin Alderson

links.description: What I learned building an opinionated and minimal coding agent
links.summary: The author built a minimal, opinionated coding agent called pi-coding-agent after becoming frustrated with Claude Code's increasing complexity and lack of transparency. The project comprises four core components (pi-ai, pi-agent-core, pi-tui, and pi-coding-agent) designed around the philosophy of excluding unnecessary features, with a focus on precise context control, full interaction transparency, and support for multiple LLM providers with seamless model switching capabilities. Key technical challenges addressed include normalizing APIs across different providers, managing provider-specific quirks in tool calling and reasoning traces, and implementing reliable token/cost tracking across diverse LLM services.
links.page_title: What I learned building an opinionated and minimal coding agent

links.description: Blue wave watch: Democrat flips Trump +17 Texas Senate seat in 32-point swing
links.summary: A Democrat won a special election for a Texas State Senate seat that Trump had carried by 17 points in 2024, flipping it with a 32-point swingâ€”the largest Democratic overperformance in a competitive special election since Trump took office. The Democratic gains were uniform across urban and suburban precincts, driven by a combination of voter persuasion against Republicans and Republican voter dropoff. The analysis suggests this signals a significant Democratic wave building for the 2026 midterms, with projected gains that could give Democrats a D+7 advantage in the generic House vote if turnout patterns hold in a higher-turnout general election.
links.page_title: Blue wave watch: Democrat flips Trump +17 Texas Senate seat in 32-point swing

links.description: Democrats hit historic high in Fox News Poll as GOP loses ground on key issues
links.summary: A new Fox News Poll shows Democrats reaching their highest generic ballot support in the survey's history at 52%, with Republicans at 46%, positioning Democrats for a potential wave election in 2026. The survey reveals significant shifts in issue ownership, with Democrats gaining ground on affordability, healthcare, and middle-class concerns, while Republicans' traditional advantages on taxes, foreign policy, and the deficit have eroded. Additionally, Trump's approval among independents has hit a record low of -40, reflecting broader deterioration in his standing as the midterm elections approach.
links.page_title: Democrats hit historic high in Fox News Poll as GOP loses ground on key issues

The way the team uses Claude is different than how I use it. Remember: there is no one right way to use Claude Code -- everyones' setup is different. links.summary: Claude Code Templates is a CLI tool that provides ready-to-use configurations and components for Anthropic's Claude Code, including AI agents, custom commands, MCPs (external integrations), settings, hooks, and project templates to enhance development workflows. The tool offers over 100+ pre-built components accessible through an interactive web interface or command line, plus additional features like analytics, conversation monitoring, and health checks to optimize your AI-powered development environment. It's open-source, MIT-licensed, and welcomes community contributions from developers looking to expand its template library.
links.page_title: GitHub - davila7/claude-code-templates: CLI tool for configuring and monitoring Claude Code

links.title: Amla Sandbox â€“ WASM bash shell sandbox for AI agents
links.summary: amla-sandbox is a security-focused sandboxing solution that allows AI agents to execute generated code safely using WebAssembly with capability enforcement, addressing the arbitrary code execution vulnerabilities in popular frameworks like LangChain and AutoGen. It enables more efficient agent workflows by allowing agents to write single scripts instead of multiple tool calls, while maintaining strict isolation through memory bounds-checking, virtual filesystem restrictions, and explicit capability-based access controls. The solution requires no Docker or VM infrastructure and integrates seamlessly with LangGraph, making it ideal for production deployments where agents need to run code with controlled tool access.
links.page_title: GitHub - amlalabs/amla-sandbox

links.description: `AGENTS.md`Â outperforms skills in our agent evals
links.summary: Vercel tested two approaches for giving AI coding agents access to updated framework documentation: a "skills" system and an AGENTS.md markdown file with embedded docs. While skills seemed like the better design choice, they failed to deliverâ€”agents ignored them 56% of the time and only achieved 79% accuracy even with explicit instructions. In contrast, a compressed 8KB docs index embedded directly in AGENTS.md achieved a perfect 100% pass rate, suggesting that passive context availability outperforms active retrieval systems for coding agents.
links.page_title: AGENTS.mdÂ outperforms skills in our agent evals - Vercel

links.description: Mecha Comet - Open source and modular hand-held computer
links.summary: The Mecha Comet is an open-source, modular Linux handheld computer currently on Kickstarter, featuring a 3.92" AMOLED display, ARM64 processor, and customizable extensions like keyboards, modems, and AI accelerators. Designed for developers, tinkerers, and enthusiasts, it runs Mechanix OS (based on Linux 6.12) and supports 67,000+ ARM packages, enabling diverse use cases from retro gaming and productivity to robotics, networking, and DIY projects. The device emphasizes repairability, modularity, and open-source software with a 7-year support promise.
links.page_title: Mecha Comet - Modular Linux Handheld Computer | Mecha

links.description: beautiful-mermaid - Figure drawing optimized for LLMs
links.summary: Beautiful-mermaid is a TypeScript library that renders Mermaid diagrams as beautiful SVGs or ASCII art, optimized for AI-assisted programming and terminal environments. It features ultra-fast rendering, zero DOM dependencies, 15 built-in themes, and a simple two-color theming system that automatically derives a complete color palette, with support for 5 diagram types including flowcharts, state diagrams, and sequence diagrams. The library addresses limitations of the default Mermaid renderer by offering superior aesthetics, easy customization, terminal output capabilities, and compatibility with VS Code themes via Shiki integration.
links.page_title: GitHub - lukilabs/beautiful-mermaid

links.description: make.ts - Building up an interactive script in the shell
links.summary: The article presents a workflow pattern called "make.ts" where developers write interactive, ad-hoc commands into a persistent file (typically named make.ts) and execute it, rather than typing commands repeatedly into the terminal or relying on shell history. This approach provides significant benefits for complex tasks, especially with multi-process applications: it allows for easier editing using a real text editor, enables running multiple commands with a single keystroke, encourages incremental improvement of commands, and simplifies process management through declarative concurrency. The author demonstrates the pattern with a concrete example of setting up and testing a distributed database cluster, showing how the workflow naturally evolves from simple sequential commands to more complex scripts with parallel execution and error handling.
links.page_title: make.ts

links.description: How to graphically derive the Golden Ratio using an equilateral triangle inscribed in a circle
links.summary: This page demonstrates a geometric method for deriving the Golden Ratio by using an equilateral triangle inscribed in a circle and a chord that passes through the midpoints of the triangle's sides. The technique combines principles of sacred geometry to visually construct this mathematically significant ratio through compass and straightedge construction.
links.page_title: Sacred Geometry:Golden Ratio:Equil.Triangle in circle:GeometryCode.com

links.summary: pandas 3.0 has been released with major improvements including a dedicated string data type that replaces the object dtype, Copy-on-Write mode for more predictable and consistent behavior, and a new default datetime resolution of microseconds instead of nanoseconds. The release includes some breaking changes that may require code updates, particularly around string type inference and chained assignment patterns, so users are advised to first upgrade to pandas 2.3 and ensure their code works without warnings before migrating to 3.0.
links.page_title: pandas - Python Data Analysis Library

links.summary: vcad is a parametric CAD library written in Rust that lets engineers design physical parts using code instead of clicking through GUI programs. Users create geometry by composing primitives (cubes, cylinders, etc.) with boolean operations, then export to STL or glTF formatsâ€”allowing rapid iteration by simply changing parameters and recompiling. The tool is designed for AI agents to generate parts automatically, with strong type safety and testing capabilities that traditional CAD files lack.

Tailscale has launched Aperture, an AI gateway in private alpha that provides organizations with visibility and control over coding agent usage without restricting developer access. Built on Tailscale's identity infrastructure, Aperture eliminates the need for API keys, supports all major LLM providers, and enables IT leaders to monitor AI adoption, costs, and usage patterns while maintaining security. The tool is extensible and designed to eventually support broader agentic AI workloads beyond coding agents.

links.description: Kimi K2.5 - A powerful open source model with strong visual and coding capabilities
links.summary: Kimi K2.5 is a powerful new open-source multimodal model that combines advanced visual and coding capabilities with a novel "agent swarm" system that can orchestrate up to 100 sub-agents working in parallel to complete complex tasks up to 4.5x faster than single-agent approaches. The model excels in three key areas: front-end development and visual debugging through image-to-code generation, autonomous task execution through self-directed agent coordination, and office productivity tasks like document creation and data analysis, showing significant improvements over its predecessor Kimi K2.
links.page_title: Kimi K2.5: Visual Agentic Intelligence | Technical Report

links.summary: Television celebrated its 100th anniversary on January 26, 2026, marking a century since John Logie Baird's first public demonstration of the technology to journalists at his workshop on Frith Street in Soho, London. Baird, a Scottish engineer, developed his electro-mechanical television system using improvised materials and successfully transmitted the first human image with William Taynton in 1925, before proving the concept to the press and Royal Institution members in 1926. Though Baird continued innovating with color TV and 3D television, his mechanical system was ultimately eclipsed by EMI's superior electronic technology when the BBC began broadcasting in 1936, and he died in 1946 shortly after television broadcasting resumed following World War II.
links.page_title: diamond geezer

links.description: MapLibre Tile: a modern and efficient vector tile format
links.summary: MapLibre has announced MapLibre Tile (MLT), a new vector tile format designed as a modern successor to Mapbox Vector Tile that addresses challenges with growing geospatial data volumes and next-generation source formats. MLT offers significant improvements including up to 6x better compression ratios, faster decoding performance through lightweight encodings, and support for 3D coordinates and complex data types, while maintaining feature parity with MVT 1. The format is available now for use in MapLibre GL JS and MapLibre Native, with demo tiles and conversion tools available for experimentation, and Planetiler supporting MLT generation for production use.
links.page_title: Announcing MapLibre Tile: a modern and efficient vector tile format | MapLibre

The featured articles discuss topics including FastRender (a browser built by parallel agents), Claude Cowork (Anthropic's general agent), and LLM-based open source code porting, all published in January 2026. The page's title "the browser is the sandbox" suggests a focus on how browsers are being used as controlled environments for AI agent experimentation and execution.

links.description: (Don't) trust the process - Better to focus on prototypes, rather than personas for UI and app design
links.summary: The article discusses the limitations of blindly following established design processes, advocating instead for a prototype-focused approach rather than relying on personas for UI and app design. By emphasizing practical prototyping over theoretical user personas, designers can more effectively validate and iterate on their work. This methodology prioritizes tangible artifacts and real-world testing as more reliable guides than abstract process frameworks.
links.page_title: Don't "Trust the Process"

links.description: The point guard mentality changed Sam Darnoldâ€™s career and is a useful mindset for everyone
links.summary: Sam Darnold's career transformation came through adopting a "point-guard mentality"â€”a mental framework where quarterbacks focus on facilitating for their teammates rather than trying to be the hero, advice he received from backup-turned-starter Brock Purdy. This simple reframing acts as a cognitive shortcut that reduces mental strain during complex decision-making, allowing Darnold to avoid turnovers, trust his system, and ultimately lead the Seahawks to a successful 14-win season and NFC Championship game. The principle extends beyond football: research suggests that when people shift from seeing themselves as the central protagonist to focusing on enabling others' success, they perform better and experience improved mental well-being.
links.page_title: The point-guard mentality didnâ€™t just make Sam Darnold better. Itâ€™s a useful mental trick - The Athletic

links.summary: "How I Became a Quant" is a book featuring interviews and insights from 25 elite quantitative analysts on Wall Street, documenting their diverse career paths into financial engineering and mathematical finance. The collection showcases how these professionals applied expertise in physics, mathematics, computer science, and other fields to develop trading strategies, risk management models, and financial innovations. Through their personal stories, the book provides aspiring quants with practical guidance on the skills, education, and career strategies needed to succeed in quantitative finance.

The phase8 is Korg's eight-voice acoustic synthesizer that combines physically vibrating steel resonators with electronic synthesis controls, featuring swappable tunable resonators, a polymetric sequencer, and multiple modulation modes. The instrument produces organic, responsive sound through haptic generation while allowing real-time physical interaction via touch and tactile manipulation, with full MIDI/USB connectivity for integration into larger setups. The presale package includes three limited-edition percussive resonators alongside the standard chromatic set for expanded sonic possibilities.

The tools are designed to simplify common mathematical conversions and calculations needed in building and construction projects.
links.page_title: Building Calculations

links.summary: The article explores the distinction between "Askers" and "Guessers"â€”two personality types that reflect different communication and etiquette styles. Askers feel comfortable making direct requests and accepting rejection, while Guessers prefer indirect communication and avoid asking unless confident of a positive response. The piece illustrates how clashes between these types can create social awkwardness, though commentators debate whether one approach is superior or whether people should adapt their style based on context and relationships.
links.page_title: 'Askers' vs. 'Guessers' - The Atlantic

links.summary: The author argues that aspiring personal website creators should prioritize writing content over selecting the perfect tools and technology stack, recommending they start with plain HTML and add sophisticated blogging engines or static site generators only after publishing multiple articles. He demonstrates this philosophy through his own website's evolution, which began as simple HTML files in Notepad and only incorporated advanced tooling years later as content accumulated, emphasizing that a functional website with meaningful content is far more valuable than a perfectly engineered site with minimal posts.
links.page_title: Writing First, Tooling Second - Susam Pal

links.summary: I don't have access to the actual content of that GitHub page, only the metadata you've provided. To give you an accurate 2-3 sentence summary of Ghostty's AI use policy, I would need you to share the actual text from the AI_POLICY.md file. Could you paste the policy content so I can summarize it for you?
links.page_title: ghostty/AI_POLICY.md at main Â· ghostty-org/ghostty Â· GitHub

links.summary: The author uses an extended metaphor comparing AI to a horse, highlighting both its capabilities and limitations. AI is faster than walking but slower and less unreliable than trains, requires constant direction and supervision, and cannot operate fully independently despite sometimes making correct guesses. The analogy suggests that AI should be viewed with healthy skepticism as a tool that needs active management rather than as a autonomous solution.
links.page_title: AI is a horse - Kevin Conner

links.description: Isometric NYC - Incredibly detailed NYC map
links.summary: Isometric NYC - Isometric NYC - Incredibly detailed NYC map
links.page_title: Isometric NYC

links.summary: Eli Bendersky describes adding a new Scheme-to-WebAssembly compiler to Bob, his long-running open-source project implementing the Scheme programming language. The project explores how to lower a complex, high-level language with features like closures and garbage collection to WebAssembly, leveraging the WASM GC extension to represent Scheme objects as boxed references that the runtime manages automatically. Key implementation challenges included representing strings through linear memory offsets and implementing the `write` function directly in WASM text to handle recursive data structures, ultimately resulting in a well-documented 1000+ line compiler.
links.page_title: Compiling Scheme to WebAssembly - Eli Bendersky's website

links.summary: The article advocates for leveraging existing machine-readable specifications and command-line tools instead of writing custom code to integrate APIs with LLM agents. By using tools like Restish (an OpenAPI interpreter) and oauth2c (an OAuth 2.0 client), the author demonstrates how to compose shell pipelines that accomplish complex tasks like accessing Google Docs and managing authentication, reducing hundreds of lines of boilerplate Python to minimal shell scripts. The approach emphasizes that LLMs should interact with APIs through Unix command compositionâ€”the same interface humans useâ€”rather than custom tool definitions, resulting in lower token costs, reusable pipelines, and easier maintenance.
links.page_title: The best code is no code: composing APIs and CLIs in the era of LLMs

links.summary: On this day in 1976, Dolenz, Jones, Boyce & Hart appeared on â€œDinah!â€. They performed a medley of The Monkees hits, including Carole Kingâ€™s and Gerry Goffinâ€™s â€œPleasant Valley Sundayâ€. - Monkees hit medley
links.page_title: On this day in 1976, Dolenz, Jones, Boyce & Hart appeared on â€œDinah!â€. They performed a medley of The Monkees hits, including Carole Kingâ€™s and Gerry Goffinâ€™s â€œPleasant Valley Sundayâ€.

links.description: WebRacket - A subset of Racket that compiles to WebAssembly
links.summary: WebRacket is a subset of Racket that compiles to WebAssembly, allowing developers to write Racket programs that run in browsers and terminals without using JavaScript. The project supports a substantial portion of Racket's functionality including basic data types, syntactic forms, tail calls, and exceptions, while providing a JavaScript FFI with bindings for DOM, Canvas, and other browser APIs. The long-term goal is to extend this compiler to support full Racket and eventually integrate WebAssembly compilation into the standard Racket compiler.
links.page_title: GitHub - soegaard/webracket: The WebRacket language is a subset of Racket that compiles to WebAssembly

links.description: Replacing app subscriptions with a weekend project
links.summary: The author replaced several paid app subscriptions (Wispr Flow, Loom, Typora) by using AI-assisted "vibecoding" to quickly build personal alternatives over weekends, discovering that what were once $10-15/month products are now trivially easy to create for individual use. While acknowledging these self-built apps lack production quality and aren't suitable for selling, the author highlights how AI-powered development has made it viable for engineers to rapidly prototype custom solutions tailored to their exact needs. This trend suggests a broader shift where standalone apps are becoming commoditized features rather than premium products, raising questions about the future of the software industry.
links.page_title: Your App Subscription Is Now My Weekend Project Â· Roberto Selbach

links.description: In praise of APL - Alan J. Perlis
links.summary: Alan J. Perlis argues that APL is the ideal first programming language for computer science education because it enables students to rapidly develop fluency in expressing algorithmic thinking through its terseness, flexibility, and composability. While APL takes longer to initially learn than languages like BASIC or FORTRAN, its powerful primitive functions and array-based design allow students to write complex programs concisely, encourage stylistic development, and make it feasible to explore diverse topicsâ€”from computer organization to graphics and file processingâ€”within a single semester. This approach emphasizes hands-on programming as essential to awakening students to computational possibilities while maintaining their independence from pre-packaged systems.
links.page_title: In Praise of APL

links.summary: Steve Yeggeâ€™s birthday blog

links.description: Golfing APL/K in 90 lines of Python
links.summary: The article explores how K programming language represents the culmination of four decades of parallel evolution between Lisp and APL, two foundational languages with complementary strengthsâ€”Lisp prioritizing semantic elegance and APL prioritizing syntactic density for mathematical expression. Arthur Whitney synthesized these traditions by creating K in 1992, which abandoned APL's multidimensional arrays in favor of Lisp's nested lists while retaining APL's powerful array programming concepts. The author then demonstrates how to implement K's core functionality in just 90 lines of Python by using "monad" and "dyad" higher-order functions that enable scalar extension, allowing any function to automatically vectorize across nested data structures without explicit loops.
links.page_title: Golfing APL/K in 90 Lines of Python - by Mohammed Alrujayi

links.summary: Soft delete implementations using archived_at columns or deleted flags are widely used for data recovery and compliance, but introduce significant complexity and operational challenges. The approach leads to accumulating "dead data" in production tables, complicates queries and migrations, and creates risks of accidentally exposing archived records. The author recommends alternative strategies such as application-level event-driven archiving to S3, database triggers that store deleted records in a separate archive table, or WAL-based change data capture tools like Debezium, all of which keep live data clean while preserving deleted records separately for recovery and audit purposes.
links.page_title: The challenges of soft delete | atlas9

links.summary: Anthropic has released their original performance take-home challenge, a coding optimization task where participants attempt to achieve better performance (measured in simulated machine cycles) than Claude Opus 4.5's best result of 1487 cycles. The challenge showcases how various Claude models perform on the task, with scores ranging from 2164 cycles (Claude Opus 4) to 1363 cycles (Claude Opus 4.5 with improved test-time compute), and anyone beating the 1487-cycle threshold is encouraged to contact Anthropic about potential interview opportunities.
links.page_title: GitHub - anthropics/original_performance_takehome: Anthropic's original performance take-home, now open for you to try!

links.summary: ScratchTrack is a macOS digital audio workstation that applies Git-style version control to audio production, enabling users to create branches for experimentation, merge changes, and maintain a complete history of all recordings and edits. The software emphasizes simplicity and focused functionalityâ€”capturing multi-track recordings and organizing them efficientlyâ€”while supporting asynchronous collaboration with conflict-free merging. It offers a free tier for solo projects with unlimited local recording, and a $10/month Pro plan that adds cloud sync and collaboration features.
links.page_title: ScratchTrack â€” Version Control for Audio

links.description: An overview of Claude Code Hooks for automating AI workflows
links.summary: Claude Code Hooks enable automation of AI workflows by providing a way to integrate AI capabilities into development processes. The article contrasts two different approaches for giving AI systems context: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and MCP (Model Context Protocol), which despite appearing similar, solve different problems and result in distinct system architectures. Understanding these differences is key to choosing the right approach for automating AI-powered development tasks.
links.page_title: Automate Your AI Workflows with Claude Code Hooks | Butler's Log

links.description: A curated list of reranking models and resources
links.summary: This GitHub repository is a comprehensive curated collection of reranking models, libraries, and resources designed to improve Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) applications. Rerankers refine search results by using cross-encoders to jointly encode query-document pairs, which is slower than vector search but significantly more accurate, typically refining 50-100 initial candidates down to the top 3-5 results. The repository includes comparisons of top models (both open-source like BGE-Reranker and commercial APIs like Cohere Rerank), integration guides for popular frameworks like LangChain and LlamaIndex, benchmarks, evaluation metrics, and practical quick-start code examples.
links.page_title: GitHub - agentset-ai/awesome-rerankers: A curated list of reranking models, libraries, and resources for building high-quality Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) applications.

links.summary: The article presents manifestation as a logical, rational process rather than mystical thinkingâ€”by clearly identifying what you want, visualizing yourself already having it, and openly receiving opportunities that align with this desire, you naturally attract those things into your life. The author argues that manifestation works because when you commit to a desire internally and exude that energy externally, others notice and offer you aligned opportunities, creating what feels like serendipitous magic but is actually the predictable result of mindset, action, and receptiveness. The key steps involve defining your desire, updating your self-image accordingly, and crucially, saying yes to unexpected offers rather than resisting or overthinking them.
links.page_title: A rationalistâ€™s guide to manifestation. - Isabel Unraveled

links.description: AI powered content engine based on Dan Kohlâ€™s content framework
links.summary: This GitHub repository features an AI-powered content creation engine inspired by Dan Koe's content framework, built using Claude Code with slash commands and subagents to automate research, ideation, and drafting. The tool includes four main commands: a swipe file generator that analyzes high-performing content, a content ideas generator that creates post outlines, a content draft generator that produces multiple variations, and a YouTube title generator that suggests 30 title options. Users can clone the repository and follow a guided workflow to build reference libraries, generate social media content, or create full drafts with structured outputs organized in dedicated folders.
links.page_title: GitHub - vincentchan/AI-Content-Engine: AI-powered content engine for research, ideation, and drafting. Based on Dan Koe's content framework.

links.summary: ReportBurster is an open-source business intelligence platform that serves as an alternative to Crystal Reports, offering report generation, automated distribution, and self-service analytics capabilities. The platform leverages AI to help users connect to databases, design reports, and automate workflows like payroll and invoicing, with support for multiple export formats and distribution channels including email, cloud storage, and messaging apps. It features embeddable analytics components, secure web portals for 24/7 access, and can be self-hosted for free as an open-source solution with optional paid support plans.
links.page_title: ReportBurster â€“ A Complete Openâ€‘Source BI Platform Inspired by Realâ€‘World Reporting Workflows

links.summary: Beats is a web-based drum machine inspired by Teenage Engineering Pocket Operators, allowing users to create and share drum patterns directly in their browser. Built with Tone.js and Stimulus.js, the tool features a simple interface with controls for tempo adjustment, beat creation, saving, and sharing capabilities through shareable URLs.
links.page_title: beats

links.description: Lume 0.2 - Build and run MacOS VMs
links.summary: Lume is an open-source macOS VM runtime built on Apple's Virtualization Framework that enables users to create and run macOS and Linux virtual machines at near-native speed on Apple Silicon. It can be used via CLI or HTTP API for various purposes including testing across macOS versions, automating tasks, running CI/CD pipelines, sandboxing risky operations, and powering AI agents. The tool requires Apple Silicon and offers features like efficient storage, Rosetta 2 support, and automated VM configuration.
links.page_title: What is Lume? | Cua

links.summary: MapToPoster is a Python tool that generates beautiful, minimalist map posters for any city worldwide by fetching OpenStreetMap data and rendering it with customizable themes. The project offers 17 pre-built visual themes (ranging from noir to neon cyberpunk to japanese ink) and allows users to control map radius, styling, and create custom themes via JSON configuration. It's designed for easy command-line usage and includes detailed documentation for developers looking to extend functionality with new map layers or themes.
links.page_title: GitHub - originalankur/maptoposter: Transform your favorite cities into beautiful, minimalist designs. MapToPoster lets you create and export visually striking map posters with code.

links.summary: This resource provides a comprehensive Docker command-line interface (CLI) reference guide organized into eight main categories: Containers, Images, Dockerfile, Volumes, Networks, Compose, and System. It serves as a quick-access cheat sheet for developers to find and copy Docker commands efficiently, with keyboard shortcuts for easy navigation and search functionality. The guide is designed to help users quickly locate the specific Docker commands they need across all major Docker operational areas.
links.page_title: Docker Cheat Sheet â€” The Ultimate CLI Reference

links.description: install.md - A standard for describing software installs to be performed by an AI agent
links.summary: install.md is a new standard format for writing software installation instructions that AI agents can execute autonomously, addressing the gap between human-readable documentation and agent-executable tasks. The structured markdown file includes clear objectives, verification criteria, and step-by-step instructions that allow LLMs to adapt installation processes to different environments and architectures without the security risks of piping executable scripts. Mintlify has already integrated auto-generation of install.md files across its documentation platform, and developers can also manually create and host these files to enable one-command software installation via LLMs.
links.page_title: install.md: A Standard for LLM-Executable Installation

links.summary: The article challenges the assumption that formal methods guarantee error-free code, arguing that formal proofs can still be sloppy and fail to prove what they're intended to. The authors highlight key problems: formal models may not be written in ways that theorem provers can easily verify, translations between code and formal systems can introduce semantic gaps, and proofs might accidentally prove trivial or incorrect statements rather than catching real bugs. They conclude that while formal verification is valuable for AI safety, it requires careful attention to these pitfalls rather than serving as an automatic safeguard against mistakes.
links.page_title: Lies, Damned Lies, and Proofs: Formal Methods are not Slopless â€” LessWrong

links.description: A critique of Cursorâ€™s long-running agent claims
links.summary: This critique examines Cursor's January 2026 blog post claiming success with autonomous coding agents that allegedly built a web browser from scratch over a week, generating over 1 million lines of code. However, the author demonstrates that the project never actually compilesâ€”finding dozens of compiler errors, failed GitHub Actions builds, and no working commits in the repository's historyâ€”exposing the codebase as non-functional "AI slop" rather than engineered code. The post argues that while Cursor never explicitly claims the browser works, they deliberately create an impression of success through vague language and screenshots without providing any reproducible evidence, working build instructions, or even a basic demonstration that the code compiles.
links.page_title: Cursor's latest "browser experiment" implied success without evidence

links.summary: While LLMs can generally produce syntactically valid structured outputs like JSON and XML, their probabilistic nature occasionally causes failures that create problems for developers using them programmatically for tasks like data extraction and code generation. This handbook provides a comprehensive guide to ensuring deterministic structured LLM outputs, covering underlying mechanisms, best tools and techniques, deployment strategies, and optimization approaches for latency, cost, and quality. The resource addresses the rapidly evolving field of structured generation by consolidating information from academic papers, blogs, and repositories into a continuously updated living document.
links.page_title: Structured LLM outputs

links.summary: Gwern.net is a comprehensive knowledge garden and essay collection authored by Gwern Branwen, featuring original research and writing on topics spanning AI, psychology, statistics, cryptography, generative models, and numerous other fields. The site is organized by category with popular pieces including work on AI scaling, neural networks for poetry and anime generation, darknet markets, and quantified self-experiments like spaced repetition and cognitive enhancement. The website also provides detailed navigation features, dark mode options, and extensive documentation across scientific, technical, philosophical, and practical domains.
links.page_title: Essays Â· Gwern.net

links.description: openwork - An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork
links.summary: OpenWork is an open-source desktop application that provides a user-friendly alternative to Claude Cowork, designed for knowledge workers to perform complex tasks without needing command-line expertise. It runs OpenCode under the hood while presenting a guided workflow interface with features like session management, real-time progress tracking, permission controls, and reusable templates. The tool is extensible through plugins and skills, works both locally and remotely, and is available as a native desktop app or web UI.
links.page_title: GitHub - different-ai/openwork: An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

links.description: Data is your only moat - How different adoption models drive better applications
links.summary: The article argues that data collection through adoption is the primary competitive advantage in AI applications, illustrated through a 2x2 framework of adoption difficulty versus problem complexity. While easy-to-adopt, easy-to-solve problems like consumer search face fierce competition from well-resourced model providers, hard-to-adopt solutions like enterprise support agents build sustainable moats by embedding themselves deeply into customer systems and accumulating proprietary data about how those organizations work. Coding tools like Cursor succeeded by combining ease of adoption with hard technical problems, enabling rapid data collection through frequent user feedback that drove continuous improvement.
links.page_title: Data is your only moat

links.description: Vega Lite Charting skill for Claude Code
links.summary: This GitHub repository contains a Vega-Lite charting skill designed for Claude Code, enabling users to create visualizations programmatically. The project is part of a larger "claude-skills" collection that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized tools and features. The repository has gained 29 stars and 2 forks, indicating community interest in this charting functionality for Claude.

Crafting Interpreters is a comprehensive book that teaches readers how to design and build their own programming language from scratch, covering both high-level concepts like parsing and semantics as well as low-level implementation details such as bytecode and garbage collection. The book guides you through creating a full-featured scripting language with features including dynamic typing, lexical scope, first-class functions, classes, and inheritance, resulting in clean and efficient code you fully understand. Available in multiple formats including print, eBook, Kindle, and free online, the book was written by Robert Nystrom, who works on the Dart language at Google.
links.page_title: Crafting Interpreters

links.summary: Cursor experimented with running hundreds of autonomous coding agents in parallel for weeks-long projects, discovering that a hierarchical system with specialized "planner" and "worker" roles significantly outperformed flat coordination structures. Their key findings showed that model selection matters greatly for long-running tasks, simpler systems often work better than complex ones, and prompt engineering is critical to coordinating multi-agent work effectively. The agents successfully completed ambitious projects like building a web browser from scratch (1M+ lines of code) and migrating large codebases, demonstrating that scaling autonomous coding through multi-agent systems is more feasible than initially expected.
links.page_title: Scaling long-running autonomous coding Â· Cursor

links.summary: Handy is a free, open-source, offline speech-to-text application that prioritizes privacy by processing audio locally on your computer using configurable keyboard shortcuts. Built with Tauri (Rust and React), it supports multiple transcription models including Whisper and Parakeet, works across Windows, macOS, and Linux, and is designed to be extensible and community-driven rather than feature-complete. The project is actively developed with known limitations on certain system configurations, particularly with Whisper model crashes on Windows/Linux and limited Wayland support on Linux.
links.page_title: GitHub - cjpais/Handy: A free, open source, and extensible speech-to-text application that works completely offline.

links.summary: A Hacker News user is building a community-maintained directory of personal websites and is crowdsourcing submissions from the community. The thread features numerous examples of personal websites shared by users, ranging from blogs and portfolios to specialized projects like garden design tools and thesaurus sites, with discussions about design choices and features. The project aims to grow beyond its current small collection by accepting quality personal websites that have been well-received in past HN discussions.
links.page_title: Ask HN: Share your personal website | Hacker News

links.description: Careful Words - A little more than a thesaurus
links.summary: Careful Words is an interactive word exploration tool created by Simon Sarris that goes beyond a traditional thesaurus by helping users discover nuanced connections between words and concepts. The platform allows users to explore semantically related terms and their deeper meanings through an intuitive interface, making it useful for writers, thinkers, and anyone interested in language and its subtleties.
links.page_title: Careful Words
